title: HERSE
content:
HERSE was the goddess of the dew, a daughter of the rain-god Zeus and moon-goddess Selene. Her moisture
        nourished the plants of the earth.

Herse was perhaps the same as Pandeia, a daughter of the same gods mentioned in the
        Homeric Hymns. Another Herse, a heroine daughter of King Kekrops (Cecrops), was worshipped by the
        Athenians.

Alcman, Fragment 57 (trans. Campbell, Vol. Greek Lyric II) (Greek lyric C7th B.C.)
          :
        "Such things as are nurtured by Ersa (Dew), daughter of Zeus and Selene (Moon)."
